name: RGeo::ActiveRecord
body:
[RGeo](http://dazuma.github.com/rgeo) is a key component for writing location-aware applications in the Ruby programming language. At its core is an implementation of the industry standard OGC Simple Features Specification, which provides data representations of geometric objects such as points, lines, and polygons, along with a set of geometric analysis operation.

RGeo::ActiveRecord is an optional RGeo module providing spatial extensions for ActiveRecord, as well as a set of helpers for writing spatial ActiveRecord adapters based on RGeo.

Adapters that use RGeo include:

* [activerecord-postgis-adapter](http://dazuma.github.com/activerecord-postgis-adapter) for PostGIS
* [activerecord-spatialite-adapter](http://dazuma.github.com/activerecord-spatialite-adapter) for Spatialite
* [activerecord-mysql2spatial-adapter](http://dazuma.github.com/activerecord-mysql2spatial-adapter) for MySQL Spatial

For more information:

* See the [documentation](http://dazuma.github.com/rgeo-activerecord/rdoc)
* Source code on [Github](http://github.com/dazuma/rgeo-activerecord)
* Report issues [here](http://github.com/dazuma/rgeo-activerecord/issues)
* Questions? Ask on the [mailing list](http://groups.google.com/group/rgeo-users)
tagline: RGeo ActiveRecord extensions and tools for spatial connection adapters
